page.title: 03HISTORY OF THE AREA
page.content: HISTORY OF THE AREA Although Roman coins have been discovered in the area, Port Tennant did not begin to grow until the construction of the Tennant Canal. This was planned by George Tennant and completed by 1824 and was used primarily to transport coal from the mines in the Neath Valley and were loaded onto ships at Salthaouse Dock which was near the present-day East Pier. In its heyday 150 000 tons of coal p.a. was shipped by the Tennant Canal, and trade only declined with the building of the Prince of Wales Dock. The beginnings of a settlement grew up around the wharves and jetties, appropriately called 'Port Tennant'. Danygraig (Under the Rock) grew up later, in the final quarter of theC19th.
